setting.time: 1930s Moscow, several weeks after supernatural events
setting.location: Same Patriarch's Ponds where everything began, now returned to normal
setting.weather: Warm spring afternoon, similar to opening scene but more advanced season

characters.appearance: Various Moscow citizens, different from opening characters, ordinary people
characters.clothing: Typical Soviet citizen clothing, work clothes and casual attire
characters.position: Some sitting on benches, others walking paths, children playing nearby
characters.action: Engaged in normal park activities, feeding ducks, reading, casual conversations

characters.appearance: Elderly park regular, 60s, weathered face, knowing expression
characters.clothing: Simple jacket and cap, worn shoes, carrying breadcrumbs for birds
characters.position: Sitting on same bench where original encounter occurred
characters.action: Feeding ducks while occasionally glancing at spot where strange events happened

scene.mainElements: Moscow park setting with ornamental pond, now showing full spring bloom, completely normal atmosphere
scene.details: Linden trees in full leaf, flower beds in bright bloom, pond clear and peaceful with ducks swimming, park benches occupied by normal citizens, children playing with balls and toys, vendor carts selling ice cream
scene.background: Moscow city life continuing normally, buildings and streets showing no trace of supernatural visitation
scene.atmosphere: Life returned to normal routine, supernatural events becoming dimmed memory, ordinary beauty of everyday Moscow park life, cycles of nature and human activity continuing regardless of cosmic interventions, no text or letters visible

composition.cameraAngle: Wide shot from elevated park perspective, showing peaceful daily life
composition.focus: Normal park life with subtle suggestion that extraordinary events occurred here
composition.depth: Foreground: park bench and pond area; middle ground: normal citizens enjoying park activities; background: Moscow cityscape continuing its eternal rhythms
